page.title: 08Laleham Burway & Gravel Pits
page.content: Just upstream of Chertsey Bridge is found Laleham Burway. There is a large recreational area on the East bank of the river which includes a camp and caravan site, a large picnic area (with a shop), and car parking facility. Further north is a canoe clubhouse. On the opposite bank of the river is Chertsey Water works and pumping station. East of the camp site there are man-made gravel pits. The pits are gradually being filled in by people wanting to dump hardcore. They are used for recreational purposes including fishing, wind surfing, water skiing, canoeing, scuba diving and sailing. These pits can be dangerous as the banks crumble. Swimmers and divers should not be there alone.
